introduce.title: Kirill Shevtsov
introduce.para1: Frontend Developer with over 6 years of experience creating web applications and websites of different complexities. Skilled in building cross-browser, responsive, and accessible interfaces using modern JavaScript frameworks.
introduce.para2: Familiar with UI/UX best practices, performance optimization, and maintaining clean, scalable code. Comfortable working independently or as part of a distributed team, with a practical approach to solving problems. Looking for a long-term, full-time remote role to contribute to meaningful projects and continue growing professionally.

umlaut.name: Umlaut.Digital
umlaut.excerpt: Dynamic. Minimal. Live. Umlaut.Digital® on the web.
umlaut.description: Together with the design team, we built a modern digital showcase for Umlaut Digital. While the designers focused on UI/UX, I handled the full technical delivery: building the frontend architecture, implementing pixel-perfect layouts, adding smooth animations, and optimizing performance. The result is a fast, stable, and production-ready website that helps the agency present itself to clients at the highest level.

ask4games.name: Ask4Games
ask4games.excerpt: Ask4Games — your gateway to the world of gaming and esports.
ask4games.description: Ask4Games is a vibrant digital hub for gamers of all kinds — from console and mobile players to esports fans. The portal brings together news, reviews, and community-driven content in a dynamic, engaging format. My role was the full technical implementation: building a scalable frontend, optimizing performance, and ensuring a smooth, interactive experience for every visitor.

dopomoga.name: Dopomoga
dopomoga.excerpt: An information portal for internally displaced persons in Ukraine, providing quick access to vital resources and support.
dopomoga.description: The project was created to help internally displaced persons in Ukraine. It was developed in a short time and with limited resources. The portal combines key information, contacts, and resources in one convenient space. The goal is to make the adaptation process easier and to provide access to help quickly and clearly. Thanks to a structured approach and a user-friendly interface, the site has become an effective support tool for people in difficult life circumstances. The site is currently out of active use due to changing needs of the target audience, but, with the consent of the owners, it remains available as an example of my work (link to the GitHub page above).

prevPortfolio.name: First Portfolio
prevPortfolio.excerpt: Previous portfolio website — My very first portfolio, where I experimented with structure, style, and technology. Simple, but meaningful as the starting point of my professional journey.
prevPortfolio.description: This was my very first portfolio website, built entirely from scratch. While it looks modest compared to my current work, it represents the foundation of my growth as a developer. Here I learned how to structure layouts, experiment with styling, and bring ideas to life on the web. It’s a project I look back on with warmth, as it marks the true beginning of my professional journey.
